scripts.say: It's over. There's nothing one can do when facing superior firepower.
You still carried out your duty well.
...Amagi, are you actually going for it?
What do you mean by that?
Do you seriously want to be the Combined Fleet's next flagship?
You still behave like the person I know, but I could sense you were different when we fought.
You're fighting with determination the likes of which I've never seen from you before.
I can think of no other reason why you would come to the front when you could get the same results by commanding your team from the back.
Who is to say that... Perhaps it's just time for a change of pace. It might turn out to be necessary.
Times are changing; if we just keep practicing the same things each year, we'll quickly be left behind on the actual battlefield.
As Nagato-sama said, the world around us is in chaos. We can't afford to wallow in our isolationism.
Precisely because this is a wargame, I'd like to test some new strategies.
If we can gather some new insight, or even learn what not do in the future, that would make this exercise a success.
Spoken like a true commander...
I understand now.
No matter who wins, I will always support the flagship of the Combined Fleet.
With these words, Hatakaze left the exercises premises.
"We will now review the results of the first day of the Naval Exercise!"
And with that, the first day of the Combined Fleet's Naval Exercise had come to an end.
*Cough, cough*... At last, it's over... She came too close to figuring out my plan...
This is what happens when I don't exercise for so long... *Cough, cough*... I feel like I could faint...
I need to hold on... just a little longer...
